correct_answer: Body language is a form of communication.
retrieved_context:
name: eye contact
type: Behavioral Cue
description: Eye contact refers to the act of looking into someone"s eyes during a conversation or interaction. It is an important non-verbal communication signal that can convey various emotions and intentions. name: Mirroring Posture
type: Non-Verbal Behavior
description: Mirroring another person"s posture can help to establish rapport and create a sense of connection. name: Facial expressions
type: Body Language
description: Facial expressions are a form of non-verbal communication that convey emotions and feelings through the movement of facial muscles. name: posture
type: Body Language Component
description: Posture refers to the position in which someone holds their body when standing or sitting. It can reveal a great deal about a person"s thoughts and feelings, and it is often used to project confidence and authority. name: gestures
type: Concept
description: Gestures are a form of body language that people use to communicate, often enhancing the clarity and effectiveness of their messages. name: Thoughts and Feelings
type: Psychological State
description: Thoughts and feelings encompass the mental and emotional states of an individual, including their attitudes, beliefs, and emotions. name: Happiness or Friendliness

description: Emotions are feelings such as happiness, sadness, anger, and surprise. name: Social Interactions

description: Eye contact is a form of non-verbal communication that involves looking directly at another person"s eyes. It can convey confidence, interest, and attentiveness. name: social interactions
type: Concept
description: Social interactions refer to the various forms of communication and behavior that occur between individuals in social settings. These interactions can be verbal, non-verbal, or a combination of both. name: body language
type: Communication Method
description: Body language refers to the nonverbal signals that we use to communicate. These include facial expressions, gestures, posture, and eye contact. name: Communication Conveyed Through Body Language
type: Communication Aspect
description: The aspect of communication that is conveyed through nonverbal cues, such as gestures and facial expressions. name: Social Interactions and Relationships
type: Social Aspect
description: Social interactions and relationships refer to the ways people communicate and form connections with each other. name: proxemics

description: Professional settings include workplaces, business meetings, and other formal environments. name: Discomfort

description: Body language includes gestures, facial expressions, and posture that convey emotions and intentions.
